ygData.subject: Re: Thanks Iskandar
ygData.msgSnippet: About putting a point in all skills. Not to be dissentious, but ... when you get to a higher level, putting one point into an skill gets you more starting
ygData.messageBody:
About putting a point in all skills. Not to be
dissentious, but ... when you get to a higher level, putting
one point into an skill gets you more starting level
in that skill. EI... once you hit level 10-- the 1st
point you put in a skill starts you at either 5 or 10.
(Correct me if I'm wrong). So if it's a skill you don't
use much, I find it better to wait.<br><br>For
example, if I'm not going to use say, jewelry making till
I hit level 30 or I don't think I'll ever use a
piercing weapon... I might wait till level 30 and then
pump a point in it when I've got a worthy weapon of
that type to use.<br><br>That way I'm making most
effective use of my points and if I REALLY need to say --
pump a sudden 20 points in a skill I've discovered is
far too low-- I won't hurt myself with wasted
points.<br><br>shooman, Monk (6th)<br><br>PS... just presenting
alternatives. And of course, anytime you get a new skill, put a
point in it. Unless of course it's the rogue's
detect/sense trap. Heh. Then just wait for the expansion,
zone, and prac it. I just read the guide and it sounds
like you autogain ability to use it just by zoning.
Even if you've never put a point in it. =)<br><br>PPS.
Trying to wade through all the prev messages on this
board. Up to like 723, and I've watched Trellan get to
level 47, leave, come back again, fade for a while and
reannounce himself. I almost feel like I know the person.
=)<br><br>Fatedhue <br>Druid of the 4th Tree hugging Ring...heh)
